medical_history.chief_complaint: The patient was referred for treatment of an orbital rhabdomyosarcoma.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The patient had been well until six months of age when excessive tearing developed. This was followed by puffy and red right eye, diagnosed as conjunctivitis, with no effect from topical treatment. Proptosis developed two days later. A CT scan obtained nine days after the onset showed a mass in the lateral orbital musculature.
medical_history.past_medical_history: The patient had been well since birth, with no relevant past medical conditions specified.
medical_history.family_history: There is no family history of childhood cancers; however, a paternal grandfather died of lung cancer and a maternal aunt died of liver cancer.
medical_history.social_history: The patient and his family resided in Canada. Social history is not specified further.
